abstract: The value of depth-first search or “backtracking” as a technique for solving problems is illustrated by two examples. An improved version of an algorithm for finding the strongly connected components of a directed graph and at algorithm for finding the biconnected components of an undirect graph are presented. The space and time requirements of both algorithms are bounded by $k_1 V + k_2 E + k_3 $ for some constants $k_1 ,k_2 $, and $k_3 $, where V is the number of vertices and E is the number of edges of the graph being examined.
